poem:
**Combat Zone**

A city of whispers  
where bread's shadow flees—  
shuttered doors clang  
in the barren wind.

Pauses fall like dust—  
grains beneath iron feet.  
Unspoken visas locked,  
on tongues of stone.  

The silent sun watches,  
a distant envoy—  
cradling the heaviness  
of unsaid truths.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "IDF declares famine-hit Gaza City a combat zone, ending ‘tactical pauses’ that allowed limited food delivery – Middle East crisis live 4.54pm BST The US denial of visas to Palestinian officials ahead of the UN general assembly meeting follow the imposition of sanctions on Palestinian Authority officials and members of the Palestine Liberation Organization in July. In a statement, the state department said that “it is in our national security interests to hold the PLO". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
